New Records: Pakistan ended South Africa’s unbeaten run in the T20 World Cup
Key Match Events: Iftikhar Ahmed and Shadab Khan scored spectacular half-centuries for Pakistan
Shaheen Afridi claimed two early wickets and Shadab removed Temba Bavuma and Aiden Markram
Pakistan rallied behind the sixth-wicket partnership of 82 between Iftikhar and Shadab
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan’s hopes of reaching the last four were already hanging by a thread coming into the match
Post-Match Reflections: The Proteas remain in second place behind India in Group 2 despite the loss and will secure one of the two semi-final spots if they beat the Netherlands in their final Super 12 match on Sunday
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a rain-shortened Super 12 match
The revised target of 142 from five more overs under the Duckworth–Lewis–Stern method was set for South Africa
Pakistan must beat Bangladesh in Sunday’s second match at Adelaide Oval to have any chance of progressing
